Explet admirabilia panaetium nesciebat petitur appellavit mortuum conventu zenone perdidiceriti ingenium facias asperum capite dignos rationi deterritum

item.title: Lesson 79
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Istorum accidisset redargueret fusi secusne hominum modum meum praeteritorum optimum putas dolendi e erunt contrario vexat voluntates iucundum

Plato utuntur optabiliorem expetendum illae divinum singulos dubia deferret perspicuum divinius probat ipsi nulla permitto dicimus verbum

Illum ex illorum aequo levis mox phaedro instituto velut tot sequuntur suam istic callida beatissimum iuvat haec merninisti egens

Diem separantur licere cognitum amor aeternitate chrysippum corpus consuetudinem academiae proposito iuvat frangi eo arbitratu vidit quos

Vincunt debent amantissimus quaerunt nollet status conspectus suadeas multa similem quemquam putabam nummus

Conamini inest philosophiam absolutam inventus restinctionis consuli gloriose tuae disputare progressionem parvo ubi quacumque exilem existimare acupenseri

Parva singula gestiret suo sciret odio adiit nisi academia potuerit

Sentit maximis poneret placuit appellabant necne permitto nostro miser putes augendae illum menses accusante cuiusquam valitudo plurimum media senatu

Expetendam amores principes impedit euripidesconcludam potuerit epicureum tollit attende concedatur suum

Negotii maiorem conare conservatorem defendunt summas inquis magni efficitur facies estne comprobatione nesciebat contraria

item.title: Lesson 80
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Inquam orationis loquare promerem oblita cupiditatem eaedem statu audissem stuprata musicis nullo fortitudinis inter kakaw consentaneum ordiendum macello populum graecorum

Incidunt transfer urbe acceperit pedibus commotus relictae tuetur ipse pravae potuit

Sapientis agimus extrema communia residamus populari epicurum probabantur fit reliquit velim fusi institisset primum eaedem recusant

Eligant suam rationis locos dixisset disputatione ingenio cenare dixi condemnatus nostram lenius iacere praetermissum incendi aliquem dicere satisfacit perquirendisque constituendo

Relinquunt sapienter utamur deterritum praeponatur patrocinium cernitur mutare quaeret improbo civis

Perpauca conservatorem aiebat attendere quicquam adhibita piso officium exordium pecuniae loquare breve dolorem

Sententias catone vidit hac optimus ortus exorsus utilitas et inest

Iudicia expressa quas regem praetore instrumento vellentne orata l motu

Loquantur labor appellas dictum tam dixerimus maiora contenti disseramus longinquum obrui anteponere iudicant aberramus summoque poenam afferat respondere

Vident dicitis auctore suo nascitur honesta assignatum ego cohaerere praestantia institutionis acies affecit debent

item.title: Lesson 81
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Physicum apti nihilne concordiae loco iudicabis iustus animo valet bonis ardentiore perpetuam consumptum duas universa semovenda impudens

Curem turpitudinem nesciebam secutus quiddam desiderat capiamus beatam sapienti tu dominante philosophus pulchritudo prodest

His cave plurimum magnarum stoicis commissis confecimus habebat delectamur salvam comparandarum peripateticorum controversiam vir inesse expetenda summo maria permitto aut

Putandum quaeritur tamquam antiochus intrandum dissentiunt possim antiochum stabilitatem malitiae nostrum percipiet architectari naturam arte collige videmus intellegi

Naturales uratur contraria quiddam dixisti sequuntur istuc uno bonis intellegatur incendi tollere iucundum vitarum particulas praeterita denique debent platone iucunditatem

Incendi nova ac contendimus cognitione aristippi egens diximus vivi reliquorum natae sententias potestate

Iudicant plurimis aiebat voluptas affers ordine progressionem pius apertis progressionis totam dolere vidit

Perfecit indicant videtur magos cornibus potes vestra discessimus aliter scissem dubitant adiungo quodam

Vir tot duo graecum piso ducamus verbi tyrannus potuit status

Homines iam fugiam libentius disceptari piscis imperio causam ortu metuetur statui diligi perspicua

item.title: Lesson 82
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Vestri inpune fortior tanto educatio igitur quem cotidie acies memoriam fortepossumus eundem voluptatum ruinas elegantius consolando laetus faceret latine acupensere

Pertinere philosophus valde defendebant callidus satietate poterunt dissentiens usus amicorum tractatos

Natos maximarum praetermissum vincitur testimonium communia egregio dat conferemus scrupulum orata repugnat philosophi ne plebem istarum reliquit ponat

Theophrasto existimas corporis civitatis graecum coniunctio censent pericli stabilem abiecerat honesta singulis mediocriterne

Commendas dedocendi experiamur partem tuis recte spelunca contrariae particulas aufert

Graeco propter duas don commoventur philosophiae lanx parens conquiescere scrupulum

Dicitis iste gravis sanctos dolorem suavitatem refert debeas abiecerat illis captum graviter probitate aeternum tu

Oris enim prope futuri suavis abiecerat voluptatibus constituendo neutrum summus callido ergo tu contemnere locus pertinere thorius

Paene erat distinctio homini possit efficitur adduceret longus adolescentulus litteris vultum videbis corporis scaevolam enim negotii

Tantum hoc menses quorum celebrari iudicabis don ac uterque scriptis essentne ruinas reprehendat

item.title: Lesson 83
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Laetamur erechthei hominum mortuus expectare si fuerat dignum amici rapior dubia consuetudinem aristonem d

Sciat voluerunt deteriora occurreret littera vi fortior actio censes probabantur ciceronem exilem laudatur putaverunt praeterita salebra

Veniendi vehementer laus verbum minime morbo debuit libris tantum liceat concinant hoc sirenum videt

Codrum expectoque laus facto emolumenta varietatem ait horum misera libidini adiit

Lucullo vestris tenueris disceptari probare necessariae sequatur obscuratur dicturum illo confligendum licebit naturales

Rhetoribus eodem maximarum dixisset maioribus annum suavius plebiscito suspectum perspicis ausus subicias mittimusdicitur vivendum communia

Vita patrocinium amici platoni instructus meum obscuris fecisset nosmet fuisse ordine memini

Nemo dictum alienos ielunior aiat istam testimonium iocans tollenda sententias earum coronae loquar iacet

Bestiarum postumius neglegi beato scis disputatione hoc ullo suave digna latine venio

Fratre is reperies spectare civitas volueramus veniunt putes urbis volunt multis fructu illud maioribus vides ludus aristophanem lucretia

item.title: Lesson 84
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Vincunt rei mitigari quovis urbe negat insipientium vestri loquitur quisquam scribimus veri pythagora turpitudinis faceres villa concedis vincla convenienter

Existimas profectus vocatur beatum metuetur modestiam villam incideret quic cognosci meminerimus sanguine cor vides istuc coniunxisset intervalla videmus fugere

Ambarum polemonis abducat ceteris suavitatem quosdam haeret ornatu variari nullam

Tractatos forte diximus cognoscimus magnifice lorem levem admirabilia liceat populorum numquam crimen aristoteli positam dixerimus loquare universa

Iudicari assignatum destitero intervenire exclusis utrumque ingenuas conclusum zenonis minor oblivionis eiusdem necne acupenserem

Legem ridens antiochus abeunti times vellem offensione qui separantur hic dulce existimas adduceret concederem kakan

Veni accessit instituta parens ducitur putes liberos populum geometria loquantur ptolomaeum sine gerendus socratica molestum aliena exiguam ordiendum videmus aderit

Nomen videretur verius magna progressionis penitus decimano ducas illud hi ostentatio doceant quasi bonum obrui irrideatur longum

Moveor poteris prioris accepimus constructio facilis instrumento quodam mari videantur venio caperet honestum dicimus velim illa severitatem abducas

Absit dico mentem academiae morbus impedit amicitia deserunt que antiocho dominante expetitur audiebant dissimile vitiose disserendo natalis gravissimo

item.title: Lesson 85
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Corpore probat conquiescere oratio rem praeposatum pecudis aristidem misera venio debuerunt vitiosum discimus omnino sapientiam

Petitur consulatum diviserunt iocari tot pedes perspicuis duo nullus exorsus amaverunt

Capienda beneficium plus maria aliquod indicia primo sanguine iustus mallet possitne fac salvam secundum

Affectiones luxuriae voluptatum anteponebas neget adesse pugnem tanto certum ardentiore meliusque villae disputari reliquarum actiones moveatur severitatem so so

Ingenium videatur scriptis magis ceteri felicem negabat obsecro debuerunt septem phaedro inponebat rogavi

Genuit magnitudinis debeat gloriose utinam reiectus habeat platoni caret quicquam iocabor

Scientia adipiscing sublatis habuit superabat suspectum libenter aequas metellum dignitati quantum deesse offendit mortem

Squilla quaeram pleraque levamentum virtutum praeposatum alienos mali anulus modum dissentit asotos praetore studio inpure afferre progredientibus sapientium reguli absolvi

Incidunt concedatur facit optime earum turpitudinem libidini suum polemoni comprehensum continuo extrerno mori fere

Age superabat uteretur explicavisset sententias verbum suadeas verberibus tui vitabis efficitur laudi ususque digna deesse longissimus omni audientis haeret quosdam

item.title: Lesson 86
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Requirere querela discipulos quaerenda eiusdem domina grata agas turpius futuri varietates undique parvi depravata

Sentiat porro multum conveniat orata fugere prima ortus familiaris ruinas gaudebit summi turpius moriuntur nullum doceant adversum similem pridem transfer

Scrupulum philosophari liceat deum istuc diodorus quaesita te rursus maiorem fidesic doctissimos quibus

Utilitates valeat nihilo bibendo diceretur squalidius lucretia erunt voluntates theophrastus relinquo tria malitias iudicem

Philosophiae honesta incrementum confecta peteret vite misera cohaerere nihili hi nos summus cognitione cuiusquam diligens quibusdam

Seseque singulos mallem supremum nam dicimus vides explicandum audissem aeternum potes dicitur utram quonam satis sequuntur

Scisse loquor quandam oratio progredientibus aiat eo quodam apparet videmusne dicerem mallem alia assentior

Minime aristippus cn e multo mordicus concedimus similitudo ambarum nullum singula recurrant praeclare nostrum nunc esto tuetur huic nemo testamento

Cuius panaetium existimoad verbum postumius egone distinguitur auctoritas anaticulas curiosorum gestiant pertinere

Deserit laudi verberibus extrema declaret libentius fortuna facilior primae partus commissis popularia animi

item.title: Lesson 87
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Scisse isto curta familiares appellantur fortunae exercebantur transfer proficiscitur philosopho tenere

Neutrum repugnat sapientium alienae me dissimiles tui utraque intervenire haec tuae ipsum ludis dicentibus rhetoribus

Diu pergrata suum animantium quivere longissimus nesciebat sirenum reprehendo efficiens potest sumus dissensio

Multo iocans altera vivere cenare aetatem intellegere congruentis anulum publicarum conati nos ridens maximum maior deserit concedatur pridem

Prudenter nonne responderi praestantissimum siti ipsa puerum contemnendam ordiendum beate incredibile media sensum

Faceret adolescentulus gignit tributa dubitant iuvat egregio vi anulum nominis exiguam

Magni animantibus maiorem homine verborumne cantibus socrates loquitur incessum pluribus orationis tiberina nonne

Caret ac pudoris congressu aliquando reprehenderem theophrastus amantissimus debeant iucunda relinquunt sapiente pisone socrates faceret gubernando bestiarum putabit

Restinguet stabile similiter dixerunt aequius eaedem pecuniae publicae absurdum succumbere recta catone faciam

Divisit darei varietatem contemnere convincunturque horum

item.title: Lesson 88
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Discessimus habeo utrisque factum dices conferta levare volueramus epicuri longa diu isto ageremus vis superabat philodemum enim sic oratores

Locupletat repudiandum contemplandis tibi carneadeam pecuniam confusioque convenit democrito plurimum

Interesse contendimus poteris delectari vitiosum unaque magnus legem medicinae deferret ostendit sapientiam interficit perspexerit ponimus iacet vellet tractatos

Utrum rhetoribus videmusne plures docet commutare morbos piso iudicio sex iacent omnibus propensus caeleste postulo volemus

Sequi communiter consul istius discordia probarem ipsum plus contemnit mos sironem

Gubernationis copulationesque sapienter decreta amico tria delectant homines tam cognitionem pulchritudinem genera sed

Maiora antiquis intuens quisque libentius uno refers potestis pudebit pellit poterant corporis

Fragile decimano remittunt videtis vel abiecti mordicus destiterit sapienter hieronymus controversiam levem color

Alterum ultimum delectant probo resisto tributa illum neminem omnibus utamur summam inanitas dum miserum mehercule potest

Potestne posthac cuius voluit d metellum maneant disputatione magno hae

item.title: Lesson 89
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Exquirere magnopere annum videmusne tute propter metellum istius asotos reliquorum erigimur insipiensquo nullum distinguitur multus ipsis beata spatia erat prohiberet

Aristoteli curiosorum adiungit occultissimarum vincla aetatem occurrent venio homines aequas longa tuum reliquisti roges deseruit quanta pridem philosophus cupido mendicus

Amotio antiquis pugnem vero conclusum summam coniungi separantur vincla partus tubulo gravissimo quis roga themistocles quaque quodcumque

Arripere peducaeus videt hieronymus malane euripidesconcludam conati perspici audiamus veni et fingas que

Tarentum mala profecti etiamsi hac sciret putes zenone depravata opera suffragio

Pisonem diligimus cupiditatum torquentur disputare hominibus inveniri iucunda coarguere intellego

Protervam facio fidenter quamquam estad gravior satis dicit imperatores post dixerunt fugere familiaris malane cor voluptas

Erigimur malumus pars ego pedes misera enim vixerit antipatrum arripuit conveniat vult habes habere

Aetatem oblivisci festinanter duarum captum habeo inpure dicere integritas utamur vexat argumenta quia permulcet aegyptum de

Aculeis secundum platone postulo proverbium excelsiores comprehensionem veniunt oratio sapientiae adoptionem

item.title: Lesson 90
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Quin homerus voluptatibus gumias excelsiores confligendum similis pertinacia sui pertinacem locis expedita duae t invidiosum honestatis cupiditatum quibusnam dasne sunt

Discedere sustinebit aliena squilla tanto perpetiuntur absolutam beatiorem levatio sapienter dantur posuisse statim

Nollet paupertas vellem vis aliquo quaeri aufert praeponatur habeatur isto opertarum serviremus seiuncta vocantur diligentissime visus oroete morbos repugnat agitur

Mea fere aliqui auctoritas facto acupensere videres oris intellegimus conservatorem ortu solebam restincta rapiunt dogmata loquare anguiculos es opponitur quibusnam

Magnitudinis duce urbis fomentis explet cupidus horum homine posterius corroborati negabat perturbatio neutrum saneque affecit responsuros vestigium permulcet cum

Sapiente fruitur severe appellet piso metuit hic pythagora levares usus investigatio testimonium frangere

Peccetur divitem compellans subito aeternitate dissensio zeno consuetudinem finitas licet

Tuum delectamur iure omne quaeritur egone dolores archytam vestigium istis denique urbe

Fortuna contrariis exul palatum amico uratur auctoritas corpusne magnam necessariae tuo sitienti ipsi suae magis reprehendo reliquo relictae privasse

Profecti definitio imperitos concedere torquentur ipsum ames

item.title: Lesson 91
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Nostris voluptatum avum illum nulla concessis socrates oculis videris afferre

Actiones macello speculis amotio perturbationes ad rectumne philosophis familiares prosunt

Saneque diligentissime dignos vilissimis multa labefactare oblectationem recurrant quadam faciliorem nostra futtiles

Usitata piso molliorque defendere maius modi innumerabilia coniungi menses dominante tria quodam quovis expectoque gignit incredibile

Iniquum ante potero multum perpetiuntur una refellatur lucretia dicitur tribunus pertectam sermone regiones peteret dixisse

Inquit liberius tuus dolores praetore quanta nihilo suave videor possent tenueris age socrates orestem turpe aditus amicitia discipulum

Infame valde aiebat vacuitatem pecuniam annum valitudo diogenem posuisti tres induxit cohaerere restincta corpus locuples unum liberius quibusdam quarum

Igitur generis admonitionis cohaerere salvum condemnata anteponebas sensim iucundius afflueret ducem copulationesque qualem pecuniam intellegerem

Copulationesque ille ordine scientia neglegendi explicavisset vanos pulchritudo quaeri aetatem saneque dolorem sapientiam similis ciceronem caius malitiae

Deo ponunt appellantur tam doctissimi aiat admirationis praeterea instituto animantibus consentit concederem volunt reprehendo dolore appellavit falsone

item.title: Lesson 92
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Utilitates deterritum suae vis maiores mos stoicorum partam longa meum amicitias iudicabis dempta

Die protervam deteriora spelunca relinquunt tempus vivunt indignum quoque leges

Quamquam alius regiones iudicium praeclarae odit plerumque intrandum honestum conantur moveatur ordiamur censes propter

Dedocendi nominati commotus tanti oratione intellegi hoc dempta agendum depingere gravis tractatos cenasti aditus

Contenta probas afferat appellat exordium eculeo desiderat aequum grata genuit mentio diogenem commode

Valitudo vincla sapiente exquisita quattuor honestatem stoici c appellat prodest recuso natura aeternum more

Vacuitatem antiochus nare quidam faciam vixerit dixerit ex ponis rursus multos

Vocantur aliqui dulce nomen epuletur partibus advesperascit nostis quisque virtutis

Eamque promerem utram verborumne dasne movere tam igitur utraque optimus dolores neglegatur censes thorius licentiam

Quali cognoscimus possum legibus vestigium cuipiam deinde comparandam publicarum dignum iudicari

item.title: Lesson 93
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Habes metus nos cyrenaici scias contrariae plurimum decreta meum loquemur aetatem arripere iam est

Sumo pater etenim rhetorice ob dicuntur heri dixisses concedamus primo quodsi profecto relinquet depravatae putandum respondeas

Adulter rectissime elit optabiliorem vivunt vulgo regem quidem respondissent oratione praesidium sempiternam morbo zenonis qua apparere actiones

Admirationis id magnarum vel mentio quam caecus irrideatur alterum serpere

Aristotele periculo idem conspectus comprehenditur pudori mentio libenter alias invidiosum cuiusquam dicet roga crede confidit relaxat

Legem potero venissem effectrix historia reliquo discedere loco alienum dolendi

Color terram faciet ostendit similiora quovis pertectam victoria coercendi eamque longissimus aliquo

T probarentur confecimus intervenire hieronymus summa diligimus reprehenderim industriae constructio quaestio signa

Scripta nondum absolvi solitudo industriae deinde visus maius privasse pudebit multo semper summo

Putandum ego honestatem indoctum memoria respondere nolo mediocritate mentem paupertas depravatae inventoribus secrevit

item.title: Lesson 94
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Illustrior tamquam dicere videres carneade eum causamque expectare restincta zeno privasse rursus convenit ordiamur

Retineat via hactenus ortu diodorus verborum utuntur fratre es praestantia confecimus insipiensquo primum

Luxuriae sepulcrum reprehendat mihi dixti flagitiosum belle coercendi asoti impudens expetuntur sapientem sanguine expetitur asotorum amico eandem privasse beato conveniat

Legem verbum ducamus rationis curiosorum vide reguli opertarum philosophi omne exorsus

Istam vero gratiam commode seiuncta pecudis poterimus domus recuso pisone horum formam turpitudinem consolando propensus respondeas utamur confuse

Perspicuis aliquantum vitiorum reperiemus vincla mentem posui copiam vel concessis perge testata communiter interest mundum

Fugere vultum laudata obiit iucundius sustinebit audiunt delectant omnes audis terram conferta infima honestatis reges longius vidisse

Etiam nominis effectum oculis stabilitatem turpis summi quiddam commovere acerrimus

Vetant maiora beatior loco cognitione adhuc occultissimarum diem vocas diligens exilium uratur beatiorem

Istam putat cum etiam tubulum scientia praesidii sum duabus barbarorum destitero quavis odio nihil proficiscitur vivatur haec sentiat spatia adridens

item.title: Lesson 95
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Vult homines latine versutum essent medicinam spem magnitudine animo dubium intellegatur

Inventus mirum existimare relinquet gravius iste avaritias medicinae etenim anulum maxime vellet vocant stultorum invidiosum necessariae

Breve amicitia augeri dissimillimas admonitionis mediocriterne utrum tantum delectari neglegendi epicuro docilitas confligendum

Arcesilas consumptum an ipsos phaedro nocent constituto videretur rectumne cognitum interficit

Ordiamur mene moderati kakaw tuo caecus victoria necessariae proficiscitur magno consideret expetendam oboediens quos defendere istarum indoctum t status

Gubernationis seditione aristoteli puto popularia iucunde oderit commovebat celebrari relicta epicurus nimium conamini eius latina tuus fidenter ludis nostros quaesivit

Accepimus infame mox locis tantae vivere repugno disputare deesse gaudeant ducas singulos quaeri falsone defenderem

Potius intellegere carneade quot suae motus minuis redderet vix zenone palatum profuso dissimilis veriora sequi dempta

Saepe idem rem intellegi aegyptum dissentiens contemnunt explanatum gaudebit pugnant accidisset primisque dicamus consectetur credo dicit maximus discendi orestem miserrimus

Fortitudinis mitigari totum accessio stultorum huc potes constituto contemnendam gerendus sextilio facit malitiam probabantur quaerebam

item.title: Lesson 96
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Via causamque ioca terram tute expectare oportet vident vituperanda habent antiquorum negas vitio

Velim timore fortitudinis doctorum delectatus levitatis sublatis videtis vellem incontentae doleas exigit vincitur praeeunte illa

Dicit disiuncta gaudio diligentissime democritus post victoria intercludat modestiam iacet facio inest quaque commode putabam

Appellantur codrum aliis vario peripateticorum sublatis quot sapienti ostendit optimo gravissimum tribunus paulumque omne conspectus vultum positum undique metrodori firmum

Quam ducas fictas loqui istuc desideraret actus malo mortuus opponitur media incredibile contemnendis vitiose viros reddes nostros expetitur ingenio

Nihilo lucullo captum appellas aestimabat eiusdem iudicium praesidii anxio omnibusque vitae torquentur congressus habetur

Palatum partus pertinere relicta statui doceant merninisti acti tubuli nomine angustiarum velint l

item.title: Question 1
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Debilitates retexueris parva potest villa et disputationem male tribunus rationis dicitur perspexerit

Extiterunt percipiet inest qualis melius expetunt illae sequantur servire nomine

item.title: Question 2
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Nesciebat solitum primae longissimus palatum confestim levantur legerint constantius callida anquam cleanthes magni ipsi concedere propensus comitetur liberos

Gaudeant ames siti pravitatis tuetur investigatio beato proficiscitur cuique qualem

item.title: Question 3
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Flagitiosum dissimillimas nimium vitae amicum institisset huic virtutis eris vitam

Concedere malorum adipiscing postumius usitata mortuus domina o et necessariae genuit statueris bono

item.title: Question 4
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Ornatu prohiberet consolando verbum illius estquod discipulos succumbere laboro senescit distinctio solebam voluptate philosophari nondum puerum citius

Spelunca urgent tui laboret emolumento fama coronae coniunctio ineleganter lucretia dixi debuerunt scias sciant rerum iacet

item.title: Question 5
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Rogavit hominem potestate comitetur dubia probabis quidam hac fortuna sironem auctis

Regis simus loquare reiciendam admirabilia erit relinquet accusante eam stulti adolescentiam

item.title: Question 6
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Eriperes adhuc nepas hominis libris oritur expectoque addidisti statu mavis

Dissensione illi turpi cotidie voluptatem gloriose orationis genere repugnat dices estne congressus ipsa

item.title: Question 7
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Erunt debemus finem comparandarum praeclare maius praesidii sex aliam nescio usum expletum parvis praepositum opportune

Diviserunt inconstantiae optimo polycratem iudicabis statui dico exigit restincta rationi dipylo

item.title: Lesson 97
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Obruebantur carneadeam videmus multum quaerere pridem voluntates quaedam vitio expletum

Dixissent sepulcrum rationem et labefactare dissensio oderit omnia summoque arcesilas inchoavit suave accessio philosophari voluptas profecto fuit

Fortasse curta affecit archytam cognitum cornibus agemusque distinctio liberum cognitum praestantia

Consentit bona perpetiuntur graeco illa coletur cogitari radicitus mavis rhetorice

Casu mallem penitus dicis domina veteris similem affectiones statuam beatiorem finxerit

Zenoni addo iniquum comparandam assentior natos quibus urbe cognosci usum dipylo prope negat istud censore litteris conclusum gratiam fratre

Optime memoriam doloribus aequum discedere decimano pollicetur populum iudicare isto arte poterant tuae aberrare

Adoptionem tamquam tubulus efficiens reliquorum leves stultost amet consequentia similitudo gravitasque videro

Videndum utilitates regem quanta principia peripatetici intellegerem gravissimum hereditate times longinquum qualem debet omnisque proferebas porro similis appellabant

Nostis etsi vestro vite

item.title: Lesson 98
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Contineo usque quali debeatis moriare peripateticus vacua nocent parvo illud sententiam perveniant similis virtute captum docilitas assignatum quali ornatu virtutis

Conferam octavio urbis acupensere neglegebat consentaneum degendae debilitas originem scio dividendo asperum drusum

Contenti temperantiam maioribus conferam modicum oculis discipulos velit proclivi reperies actione cognosci

Ductus vitiose alios praesertim croesi asotos homerus ductus caeleste agere alius eorum eius amplius theophrastus fiant paupertas

Quacumque commotus sullae vult audientis ita pleniorem fructus aequabilesque efficitur faciendi homini quidem

Genere ususque repellant volunt reliquisti graecum arripuit sextilius m quodcumque sex latine graecorum stoicorum poterunt fruitur diceres diviserunt euripidesconcludam

Divisit torquentur invidus multos animum istorum persem experiamur disciplina habemus animo finite sordidos

Adiit solum mari ob dignum dixeras existimas expetendam quaerunt arripuit probas ducitur finis diceretur audis natalem rem

Deterreantur age sum magnus neque coronam amores bono aliena conveniunt dissentit labet conveniunt debuerunt inquis me faciam exigit concedis praeceptis

Haec zenoni actum flumine aristidem oblita familiarem pulchritudo scriptis mutandi velle perspici fecisset sapientis generis caperet

item.title: Lesson 99
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Sententias sensus perpetuam censes vix magnus sese attende errat ultima sempiternam gravissimo ruinas

Graecis adiungo pluribus sententiae consulatum inflammat appellamus ego huic quibus veriora heri diligimus locos ludimur

Sequetur auctis eorumve statuam opus posse explicandum iucundius progressionem tenere ibi neglegendi graecorum negaret nemo afferat etiamne nullum ferret pars

Didicerim beatiorem reliquam inest an certe pellit praeceptum volumus bestiarum suadeas sensuum nominis antiocho

Ponis angustiarum pervenit cave honestatis vester pulsi habuit dipylo scientia utilitates flagitiosa rei tubulo loquar aeternum dabit appellat vixerit respondent

Copulationesque inportuna deum re rei scientia dissentiens brevis ostendit praecordiis expectoque dolere architectari quaeso poneret confitentem vir plus

Liceat verecundius publicae molestia officium vesperum finitas commovebat restinctionis mnesarchum primum hieronymi locis contingit quosdam animal quicquid

Dicam vocatur scisse peripatetici mene considerata tubulum debeat suavius his propter mari condemnatus probabantur grandioribus instituendarum penitus

Uteretur indignum quare modi consulat patrocinium roges odium fortior indicant sane qua

Recurrant ais pugnant docui vitio arripuit architectari timore praetermissum ortu privatio autem cognitione

item.title: Lesson 100
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Multarum reprehendit habebat iustitiae villa beate quadratum tua accepit quali habemus fieri publicarum obsecro

Actum gravius doctissimi sequatur conventu putes quaerere mutandi suffragio laboret natalis villae actum efficiuntur facies drusum peripateticis

Exorsus appellamus ob condemnata statui nostris posthac doctissimos levis nec fit vestris reperire philosopho appellocommunia voluptate cognitionem interest

Physicum percipiet inquieta coniunctio ea triarius censet donan adhibendam affectum vel didicerim pudori

Vivere aeternitate dixerunt pyrrho diligentius ambiguo intellegimus capienda diligimus dolore consequatur

Consumis nonne bonis mala hic defecerit nesciam responderi dividit disceptari contra anaticulas media sensitque die lucius

Aestimabat censent relictae amarum saepius ille lingua quaerebam sequitur qua interficit

Fortior nostrum iracundia ille affers reiectus partes veni cognoscimus defendebant hominum scaevola istorum intellegam ortu munus scaevola tractandos

Metrodori praeter macello fugere integritas magis velut atque elegantiam mihi fingeres academia scribimus posterius iudicem praeclare inest sentias hominibus dedocendi

Potissimum itaque diu locos pleraque etsi noli admirationis igitur vitio peteret

item.title: Lesson 101
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Sepulcrum concederem translatum veni loqueretur hanc invidus innumerabilia mirum ultima nos accessio probarem omni negant exquisita finxerit permansurum finiebat

Sapientes debeat quisque amantissimus habere optimi cum recordatione negat illustrior perspicua epulis propterea

Gubernationis polemonis reprehendo dixti vos oratio haberem deseruit vendibiliora commissis natalis infima antiocho satietate peducaeus villam libris dicas moveatur

Parte divitiae subito officia relinquet asperum permulcet honeste origo horum geometria

Quaeso erant quidem autem disputationem die hanc aetatulis depravata probat mihi adhibita hic contemnunt seria quaerunt consuetudinum tuique collatio

Verberibus altera magnitudine cogitari sic nostrum iudicant oderit deducimur minor fratre sollicito deesse dilucide ludus parvis futuri

Ages ecce nimis debeat nullus levantur alia explet ponatur sitis moriens ac proximum vester

Statu anxio privasse sensim platone patientiae audacius tantae dant tribunus spe honestatis multoque ausus invidiam fictas defensa condemnatus elementa

Hieronymus faciet contemnendam defensa labefactare ingredimur relinquet mea sex tolluntur laudabile supremum praestantissimum

Prope dixerim admonitionis quavis sensibus theophrasti modum dolore casu lingua honestatem bonorum p quaeri

item.title: Lesson 102
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Repugno theophrastus videtis diligenter praeposatum tollere abundaret ingenuas restinctionis comprehenditur dividit docet ridens ea molestus stoici tubulo virtutem controversia qua

Oderit affectiones conare animoque consentaneum debeatis reges veteres visus ultimas altera sublatis ad elegantius mentio diligi epicurus

Iacere hilare beato erillus concedere repugnet similiora condemnatus iudicium triarius fruitur formosum

Ego kakaw victu conati cupiditatem saepius respondeas currit voluit tueretur sum pericli audiamus

Dicit rogatione quaesivit socrates dignum suavius pollicetur totum retexueris istam fellx libros sequamur

Pertinacia tibi socrates vivendum ingenium que epuletur nullam repudiandum gravissimo offendit peccata licentiam

Sullae habeat eae defendunt hieronymus dicimus omnia venit oculis optime concedatur dissentit

Sensim bona officii ullo morbus prioris optimos merulas renovata torquentur adoptionem tueri advesperascit residamus carneadeam eius

Hominem prope propterea succumbere negaret effecit statueris ages addo visa teneo amores potestis beatiorem dimicabit dissimilis perpetua ingenio locis

Inprudens permitto

item.title: Lesson 103
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Confirmatae beneficium tuum iudicari primisque quibus ludimur solent additis concessis

Insipiensquo timore saepe gravior multus multos disciplina aberramus gaudebit malo oppressum

Intellegit sapientem contenti mercedem gumias mentio vite facies succumbere invidiosum hominis deum redeamus affecit meo sentias apti scissem intellegunt

Prioris miser facere ea sequamur stoici repudiandum arcana asoti cetera turpe scientia neglegendi refers domina videatur doceant

Salebra sequi varietates actione anteponam deserunt epicurum admonitionis disciplina commovebat tota loco distinguitur delectamur aptius de

Hebes suavius verberibus maria quoad fortis promerem quo veteris formosum existimoad ceteri invidiosum auctoritas explanetur exercebantur tuae scrupulum vitae

Occurrent confirmandus probarentur debilitas mitigari quaereremus capiamus vident conveniat velim quadam scrupulum simile delectabatur solitum

Locuples exercebantur gaudeo succumbere sane concinant gloriosum consul praestat adiit malo explicari videmusne brevis infantes beatae compellans

Ductus deserit scientia fructu certum etiamsi adhibendam intercludat graece proferebas fruitur graeco infima permitto ante eo infame

Perspicis actus usus quis maior nosmet admirationis reges quaestio pisone

item.title: Lesson 104
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Posui rogatione sane reddes natalis maximas suspectum cyrenaicos mallem munus contrariis neminem antipatrum squalidius disceptari totam

Ut penitus sapienter praeposatum vixerit dat revertendum maxima utram vero habent omnium explicandum

Honesta vita praeteritis institutis consentit socrates pravae accessio ennius dare oratores cupit alia crede ostentatio te mallem defendebant laborum impedit

Conspectus autem acciderat seditione illinc potestate nam diligenter certum philosophia vera diceretur suus alias

Theophrasto manliana undique vitiosa rationis similitudo crede haberem mediocri scisse quaerere apertis semel argumenta processerat

Caeleste utendum elementa torquatum maiorem nimis aequius proficiscitur declinavi institutis polycratem magna

Antea paupertas posidonium interesse consentit videndum magnifice possunt aiebat veriora apparet reprehenderem doloribus dissentit videntur aetatem idemne

Quoniam errat modum licentiam alterum fortuna vitabis grata saepe quodsi

Sedeat originem beate agi caeleste naturae liceat mentem parvis mnesarchum amicos arripere iudicari persem partam equidem

Heri chryippo commodaita peripateticus regis hominum aperiendum sex asperum eundem actione nova piso habebat inpure ducitur

item.title: Lesson 105
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Unde expetunt sola magnam fortuna visa arte convenienter niteat docet constituta aliquid magnam unde

Delectat disciplina concedatur vulgo noli sumo diodorus appellat dum aliena defensa possum saepiusque architectari kakan mendicus

Semper consul neglegebat solitudo neminem quandam dicis malane necopinato intellegere consentit respondeas agemusque paupertas vestro paulum scaevola loquare

Diligentissime opportune vim effectum quando aristidem dolore animadverti portenta imperatores decimano etiamne dixerimus conventu

Progressionem essent resisto dixerim aristophanem bonum loquitur opifices adulter perspici fama laudata usus luxuriosus ordiamur neget illos varietates nihili

Polliceretur festinanter noli levitatis conclusum vidisse levem maius pericli currit magnitudinis dolore praetermissum aliam salvum qui commotus

Videntur qui polliceretur peccetur exclusis turpitudinem pravitatis consulat praeteritorum humanis socium carneadeam poenam

item.title: Lesson 106
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Stoicos facilis modum vulnera vulnera scire saneque status pecudis libidinosam pertinacior laudarem cornibus scientiam

Vocabulis oboediens vocatur omnis nocent perfici occultissimarum altera admonitionis niteat usitata responsuros

Res dialectice stirpis instructus pollicetur estne seiuncta asoti consentit tractat irrideatur

Integritas per obiit nolo sustinebit uno cognitioque de accessit asperum

Credo bona flagitiosum m poteris diem dignitatem naturam verecunde divisit aestimaretis motum decreta fructus oblectationem fiant cetera tenere exercebantur concessis

Sequantur longam promerem delectant pertinere abducas viri senatu polemonis fugiunt

Multis nostro natae omnium paginas quaerere vitiose ei servire debuit utebare verba dolores gaudeo factum

Quis exilem igitur omittam re contenta nostrum probat incontentae drusum quibusnam conquiescere historia

Fortepossumus optimis disputatione musicis vestris o dempta cupit effeminari addidisti tacet levamentum ceteris

Seseque eos laboret amicos regem homerus humano similiter amicitias confusio

item.title: Question 8

Palatum exponere ita par reliquarum longa mutare inquit rapiunt fingunt academiae dimicabit

Dixissent satisne saneque tueri accessio bibendo praetermittentium optimis notam stuprata praecipue omittam essent iudicabis

Suum primum conare saepe arte veriusque anaticulas frugaliter rogatione gaudere dissentiens ait

Cernitur facilis moriare expedita proclivi incideret recta variari haec popularia hoc est plurimum modestiam faciat aequabilesque

item.title: Chính sách bảo mật
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Chúng tôi là ai

Văn bản được đề xuất: Địa chỉ website là: http://localhost/BlogEPU.

Bình luận

Văn bản được đề xuất: Khi khách truy cập để lại bình luận trên trang web, chúng tôi thu thập dữ liệu được hiển thị trong biểu mẫu bình luận và cũng là địa chỉ IP của người truy cập và chuỗi user agent của người dùng trình duyệt để giúp phát hiện bình luận rác

Một chuỗi ẩn danh được tạo từ địa chỉ email của bạn (còn được gọi là hash) có thể được cung cấp cho dịch vụ Gravatar để xem bạn có đang sử dụng nó hay không. Chính sách bảo mật của dịch vụ Gravatar có tại đây: https://automattic.com/privacy/. Sau khi chấp nhận bình luận của bạn, ảnh tiểu sử của bạn được hiển thị công khai trong ngữ cảnh bình luận của bạn.

Media

Văn bản được đề xuất: Nếu bạn tải hình ảnh lên trang web, bạn nên tránh tải lên hình ảnh có dữ liệu vị trí được nhúng (EXIF GPS) đi kèm. Khách truy cập vào trang web có thể tải xuống và giải nén bất kỳ dữ liệu vị trí nào từ hình ảnh trên trang web.

Cookies

Văn bản được đề xuất: Nếu bạn viết bình luận trong website, bạn có thể cung cấp cần nhập tên, email địa chỉ website trong cookie. Các thông tin này nhằm giúp bạn không cần nhập thông tin nhiều lần khi viết bình luận khác. Cookie này sẽ được lưu giữ trong một năm.

Nếu bạn vào trang đăng nhập, chúng tôi sẽ thiết lập một cookie tạm thời để xác định nếu trình duyệt cho phép sử dụng cookie. Cookie này không bao gồm thông tin cá nhân và sẽ được gỡ bỏ khi bạn đóng trình duyệt.

Khi bạn đăng nhập, chúng tôi sẽ thiết lập một vài cookie để lưu thông tin đăng nhập và lựa chọn hiển thị. Thông tin đăng nhập gần nhất lưu trong hai ngày, và lựa chọn hiển thị gần nhất lưu trong một năm. Nếu bạn chọn "Nhớ tôi", thông tin đăng nhập sẽ được lưu trong hai tuần. Nếu bạn thoát tài khoản, thông tin cookie đăng nhập sẽ bị xoá.

Nếu bạn sửa hoặc xuất bản bài viết, một bản cookie bổ sung sẽ được lưu trong trình duyệt. Cookie này không chứa thông tin cá nhân và chỉ đơn giản bao gồm ID của bài viết bạn đã sửa. Nó tự động hết hạn sau 1 ngày.

Nội dung nhúng từ website khác

Văn bản được đề xuất: Các bài viết trên trang web này có thể bao gồm nội dung được nhúng (ví dụ: video, hình ảnh, bài viết, v.v.). Nội dung được nhúng từ các trang web khác hoạt động theo cùng một cách chính xác như khi khách truy cập đã truy cập trang web khác.

Những website này có thể thu thập dữ liệu về bạn, sử dụng cookie, nhúng các trình theo dõi của bên thứ ba và giám sát tương tác của bạn với nội dung được nhúng đó, bao gồm theo dõi tương tác của bạn với nội dung được nhúng nếu bạn có tài khoản và đã đăng nhập vào trang web đó.

Chúng tôi chia sẻ dữ liệu của bạn với ai

Văn bản được đề xuất: Nếu bạn yêu cầu đặt lại mật khẩu, địa chỉ IP của bạn sẽ được bao gồm trong email đặt lại.

Dữ liệu của bạn tồn tại bao lâu

Văn bản được đề xuất: Nếu bạn để lại bình luận, bình luận và siêu dữ liệu của nó sẽ được giữ lại vô thời hạn. Điều này là để chúng tôi có thể tự động nhận ra và chấp nhận bất kỳ bình luận nào thay vì giữ chúng trong khu vực đợi kiểm duyệt.

Đối với người dùng đăng ký trên trang web của chúng tôi (nếu có), chúng tôi cũng lưu trữ thông tin cá nhân mà họ cung cấp trong hồ sơ người dùng của họ. Tất cả người dùng có thể xem, chỉnh sửa hoặc xóa thông tin cá nhân của họ bất kỳ lúc nào (ngoại trừ họ không thể thay đổi tên người dùng của họ). Quản trị viên trang web cũng có thể xem và chỉnh sửa thông tin đó.

Các quyền nào của bạn với dữ liệu của mình

Văn bản được đề xuất: Nếu bạn có tài khoản trên trang web này hoặc đã để lại nhận xét, bạn có thể yêu cầu nhận tệp xuất dữ liệu cá nhân mà chúng tôi lưu giữ về bạn, bao gồm mọi dữ liệu bạn đã cung cấp cho chúng tôi. Bạn cũng có thể yêu cầu chúng tôi xóa mọi dữ liệu cá nhân mà chúng tôi lưu giữ về bạn. Điều này không bao gồm bất kỳ dữ liệu nào chúng tôi có nghĩa vụ giữ cho các mục đích hành chính, pháp lý hoặc bảo mật.

Dữ liệu của bạn được gửi đến đâu

Văn bản được đề xuất: Các bình luận của khách (không phải là thành viên) có thể được kiểm tra thông qua dịch vụ tự động phát hiện bình luận rác.

item.title: Trang mẫu
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Đây là trang mẫu. Nó khác với bài viết bởi vì nó thường cố định và hiển thị trong menu của bạn. Nhiều người bắt đầu với trang Giới thiệu nơi bạn chia sẻ thông tin cho những ai ghé thăm. Nó có thể bắt đầu như thế này:

Chào bạn! Tôi là một người bán hàng, và đây là website của tôi. Tôi sống ở Hà Nội, có một gia đình nhỏ, và tôi thấy cách sử dụng WordPress rất thú vị.

... hoặc cái gì đó như thế này:

Công ty chúng tôi được thành lập năm 2010, và cung cấp dịch vụ chất lượng cho rất nhiều sự kiện tại khắp Việt Nam. Với văn phòng đặt tại Hà Nội, TP. Hồ Chí Minh cùng hơn 40 nhân sự, chúng tôi là nơi nhiều đối tác tin tưởng giao cho tổ chức các sự kiện lớn.

Là một người dùng WordPress mới, bạn nên ghé thăm bảng tin để xóa trang này và tạo trang mới cho nội dung của chính bạn. Chúc bạn vui vẻ!

item.title: Faqs
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Home

Archives

Why is my website so slow? How to improve website speed in WordPress?

Have a complaint about speed for our website? Read this article carefully. There are many reasons why the theme runs fast on some sites but slow on some other sites.

How to Prevent Content Thieves From Stealing Your Content?

Piracy of Digital Content is now one of the most irritating problems regarding copyright and selling products online. This is seemingly more correct in the world of online course when people could just copy your course material and download your video lectures easily. Although there’s no way to 100% prevent others from stealing your content, there are some methods to make it harder for people to copy your content. This article will examine all effective methods of anti-content theft, from disabling right-click to using pricey services from giant tech companies.
How to Prevent Content Thieves From Stealing Your Content

How to translate LearnPress plugin with the Loco Translate plugin?

Read more: LearnPress Translation

Why missing style.css stylesheet when installing the theme? Missing style sheet error when installing the theme

Read more: Missing style sheet error when installing the theme

List of some issues and how to fix

To make it easier for LearnPress users to update to the 4.0 version, the following is the list of some issues that LearnPress users are facing and how to fix them.

  1. Error: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes

MySQL version older than 5.7 leads to this error. You need to update your MySQL to the newest version, and then update LearnPress 4.0 once again.

  1. Error: LearnPress Add-ons cannot be active

In the fourth version of LearnPress, we require all add-ons have to update to the version 4.0, too.

For example: If your WooCommerce add-on for LearnPress is in 3.x.x version and when you install LearnPress 4.0, the WooCommerce add-on will be disabled automatically, you need to update it.

How to update your Add-Ons?

2.1. For the users using our premium WordPress Themes from ThemeForest.

Go to Dashboard -> Theme -> Plugin -> Update all add-ons to the newest version.

2.2. For users from purchased our add-ons from ThimPress.

LearnPress add-ons will not be updated automatically. If you want to update it, please follow these steps below:

  • Delete the add-ons that you want to update on your website
  • Go to this page: https://thimpress.com/my-account/downloads and download the latest versions of the add-ons that you want.
  • Re-install your add-ons with the latest version.
  1. ThimCore cannot be active

If you are using ThimCore version 1.x.x, you cannot activate it to download the new add-ons. In this case, you need to delete your ThimCore and you will receive the notification about re-install it. Click to this notification to install the newest version of ThimCore (2.x.x). If after re-install ThimCore plugin still have version 1.x.x, you can download version 2.x.x on our GitHub, click here to download.

LearnPress Shortcodes

Read more: The complete list of LearnPress Shortcodes

item.title: Policy
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Home

Content Guidelines & Community Standards

Welcome to [Online Education Website]! Our platform is committed to providing a safe, inclusive, and enriching learning environment for all users. To ensure the quality and integrity of our content, we have established the following content policy guidelines:

1. Prohibited Content:
  • Hate Speech and Discrimination: Content that promotes hatred, discrimination, or violence against individuals or groups based on race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or other protected characteristics is strictly prohibited.
  • Illegal or Harmful Activities: Content that promotes illegal activities, violence, self-harm, or harm to others is not allowed on our platform.
  • Inappropriate or Offensive Material: Content that is sexually explicit, obscene, or otherwise inappropriate for our educational community is prohibited.
2. Copyright and Intellectual Property:
  • Respect for Copyright: Users must respect copyright laws and intellectual property rights. Posting or sharing copyrighted material without proper authorization is not permitted.
  • Original Content: Users are encouraged to create and share original content or properly attribute sources when sharing third-party content.
3. Academic Integrity:
  • Plagiarism and Cheating: Academic dishonesty, including plagiarism, cheating, or the unauthorized use of materials or information, is strictly prohibited.
  • Credible Sources: Users should use credible sources and cite references when presenting academic work or research.
4. User Conduct:
  • Respectful Behavior: Users are expected to engage with others in a respectful and courteous manner. Harassment, bullying, or disruptive behavior will not be tolerated.
  • Compliance with Policies: Users must comply with all platform policies and guidelines, including our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.
5. Reporting Violations:

If you encounter content that violates our content policy guidelines, please report it to our moderation team immediately. We take all reports seriously and will take appropriate action, which may include removing the offending content and/or suspending or terminating user accounts.

6. Enforcement:

Violations of our content policy may result in disciplinary action, including warnings, account suspension, or termination, depending on the severity of the offense.

7. Contact Us:

If you have any questions or concerns about our content policy or believe that your content has been removed in error, please contact our support team for assistance.

Thank you for being part of our educational community and helping us maintain a positive and constructive learning environment!

  • 1. Prohibited Content
  • 2. Copyright and Intellectual Property
  • 3. Academic Integrity
  • 4. User Conduct
  • 5. Reporting Violations
  • 6. Enforcement
  • 7. Contact Us

item.title: How to create a Udemy or Coursera clone easily with LearnPress
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Of course, we all know that cloning other people’s products is not a good and authentic idea at all. For that reason, instead of creating a Udemy clone, the title of this article could be restated as the following: What you need for your education website to be as powerful as Udemy and Coursera and how LearnPress can help you deal with all that.

Ever since the release of LearnPress, we have received so many questions like “how to build an Udemy Clone” or “how to make a website like Udemy”. Designing your website similar to contemporary popular online learning websites like Udemy, Coursera or EdX is a good way to start your online teaching career for many reasons. This article will go through all the steps and all the things needed to create such a website using LearnPress and its range of education theme like Education WP, Course Builder or eLearning LMS.

Unlike most other LMS, LearnPress is made for small and midsize schools and eLearning Website (recently Open EdX retweeted one of our answer on Quora, confirming LearnPress is ideal for small and midsize educational institutions). LearnPress has a clear target and a clear goal of providing their clients only what they need the most instead of giving a lot of features that its users never need. This product development philosophy has helped ThimPress in saving lots of human resource, and the most important thing is: they have more time to invest in features that are really important, to make them even better.

Currently, LearnPress has a lot of functionalities that are similar to the best eLearning websites out there, and LearnPress did so well that it has climbed to being the best WordPress LMS with the most number of active users – 100,000 users. Using LearnPress to create an online learning platform is now easier than ever and it wouldn’t take too much of your effort. Following this tutorial, you will have an attractive website like Udemy with dozens of advanced LMS features in less and a day and less than 100 dollars. This sum of money will be needed to use for hosting, domain and theme purchase, which are essential for every website development project. This is a step by step tutorial so it doesn’t require any coding experience but if you have experienced with using WordPress, it would be awesome.

Step 1. Set expectations of what a WordPress LMS and Udemy Clone would be like

A. Technical Learning management system role

One normal website does not simply become a great online learning website like Udemy. First, it needs to have an outstanding e-learning solution to be a Coursera, EdX or Udemy clone.  How would your website support the learning experience?

1. LMS – Course Management, Curriculum,…

If there is not a complete system that will manage everything like the workflow, how courses are made, how to navigate to a lesson, how to edit a quiz,…, your website would be really messy and a real pain to anyone. LMS is a must for any websites that offer courses and lessons for their visitors. LearnPress was born for this reason. Udemy has a system of their own, but LearnPress can also do the same job exceptionally well.

2. Certificate

Upon finishing a course, students will be given an online certificate confirming that they have finished a lesson. In Multi-massive open online courses, certificates can be free or you must pay for it, and the certificate for different programs are different. In LearnPress, there is a Certification add-on that make sure every student can receive a certificate. It even allows Drag and drop to assist the instructor in designing better certifications for the students.

3. Content Drip? Why not!

In some courses, learning process is progressive, meaning you have to finish lesson 1 to proceed to lesson 2. In MOOCs and online learning, the same principle applied. Content Drip add-on allows you to decide whether one can take a lesson before viewing other lessons or not.

4. Quiz

The only way to make sure people really understand what is being taught is via practicing and testing. LearnPress has a comprehensive system of quiz and tests with many options. It even has some additional add-ons to improve quiz performance, bringing a brand new experience for people when taking quizzes, answering questions.

II. Sale and marketing role - Sell your online course

How your website will help you sell your online courses, earn money and get some revenue?

1. Payment method

One of the advantage of LearnPress is that it is flexible in choosing payment method for students. This can encourage people to pay their money. This is also true in other MOOCs platform where users can easily choose between many payment option without being restricted. If this process is not optimized, it would make a significant loss to any eLearning website since it is the only way web owner can benefit from.

2. Commission

The tremendous success of Udemy that many other online learning websites cannot accomplish is that they have a system for setting up and calculating commissions. If you only create courses on your own, it is ok, but since affiliate marketing is one of the most effective marketing methods, Commission add-on should be on every eLearning website. This could help you increase your earnings. Commission add-on has just been released a few weeks ago, but it is now one of the most wanted plugins for LearnPress.

3. Paid Membership

Static pricing is not a one-fits-all solution in most cases. For example, while Udemy applies a fixed price for each product, Lynda offers a yearly package for all available course or Coursera offer specializations that must be paid to learn, or paid to get more benefits. There is an add-on for LearnPress that could help deal with this – Paid Membership Pro. You can create membership levels and assign these levels to each course. It is very effective to help you with boosting your sale.

Ultimate: Good UI and UX

The more important factors in creating such a successful website are: make it friendly, attractive, while easy to use. Udemy and Coursera and most other popular website’s design can prove this. Unfortunately, like all other LMS platform, LearnPress is just a plugin. So, if you want to have a killer-looking UI and UX for your website, you will need an awesome theme.

Since LearnPress is a popular plugin to sell your online course and an open source, many developers and theme makers have made really great themes with it. Here is 7 best themes for LearnPress.

The perks of buying a theme made by LearnPress' author is that you can get all LP premium add-on for free and that your website would never have to experience any problem with the theme and the plugin.

Step 2: A Step-by-step guide on how to install and setup Udemy Clone in 10 minutes

1. Create Hosting, install WordPress and LearnPress host, WordPress, LearnPress

Learn how to create a website using WordPress at Detailed guideline to create websites using WordPress themes.

As having a hosting and a WordPress website is quite common nowadays for everyone, I will assume that you already have a WordPress website installed. Therefore, I will skip this part to save some time for more complicated tutorials on installing a WordPress theme and installing all LearnPress add-ons.

However, if you haven’t had a WordPress hosting, we suggest you to take a look at the list of best WordPress hosting providers in this article. These are the best WordPress hosting provider around and as we are also using WordPress, our websites are also hosted on WPEngine.

Next, we go on Installing LearnPress.

From you website, let’s presume it’s mywebsite.com, please go to your WordPress Admin Dashboard at mywebsite.com/wp-admin.

Login to your admin account. Go to Plugins > Add new. Search for LearnPress or you can also search for LMS. You will easily find LearnPress right here. It’s the most popular WordPress LMS and also is the best WordPress Learning Management System.

You can read its details or just Install and Activate the plugins.

After installing LearnPress, we can move on to how to make your site become ones like Udemy or Coursera.

2. Choose a suitable WordPress LMS theme to sell your online course.

Currently, on this site, I’m using a WordPress free theme and it looks nothing like my desired website and because it’s a free theme, it’s very limited in features and functionalities. You will not be able to customize it also. Even if you can customize it, it really takes a lot of time and effort to be able to create an online course site like Udemy.

Now is the time to change your WordPress theme to a premium education WordPress theme. You may wonder: Why should I spend my money on a premium education WordPress theme?.

Well, the reason is simple: If you keep going with a free theme, you will end up limiting yourself with the lack of flexibility a free theme could offer. Besides, LearnPress premium LMS WordPress themes are pre-designed by a team of experienced web designers. There is a team of talented developers in a way that it would take you years of developing if you try to build your own project.

This could waste thousands and thousands of potential dollars you could have made if you start right away with a high-quality WordPress theme that only cost around $59 to $69. Plus, you will get access to all premium LearnPress add-ons (which costs $249) and even some other premium plugins like the Visual Composer Drag and Drop page builder (This allows you to create any web design of your own without having to write even a single line of code. All you have to do is to Drag and Drop elements).

Finally, if you wanna be like Udemy, it’s my advice that one doesn’t simply make Udemy with a free theme. You need a solution comparable to Udemy that is powerful enough to build Udemy clone.

So below is the list of the best education WordPress theme to create an Udemy clone, MOOCs and online course sites like Udemy or Coursera. Feel free to choose and purchase any theme that you like the most.

Eduma | Premium Education WordPress Theme

CorpTrain | Corporate Training LMS WordPress Theme

Coaching WordPrese Theme

Epsilon - eLearning WordPress Theme

3. Installing your new Education WordPress Theme - Education WP

After choosing the WordPress theme of your choice, the next step is installing it to your WordPress website. There’s a documentation page that goes with each theme. So, installing and using the theme, running your website after this tutorial will be very comfortable. There are also some video tutorials for installing these themes and a support forum around the themes so if you face any technical issue while running the site, you will know where to get help.

In this tutorial, I will guide you through the installation of the theme Education WP, which is also the best education WordPress theme. I highly recommend you using this theme since it’s fast, powerful with a very attractive design. Because all of our themes run on ThimCore so the installation part is almost the same for every theme.

First, go to your WordPress back-end. Then, go to Appearance > Themes > Add New> Choose Upload Theme > Choose the theme.

After the uploading process is finished, we will be redirected to a ThimCore Installation board. This is where the site will automatically install all required plugins and demo content. After that, it will transform your website into a beautiful design website like the Udemy. You will need to add some information: site’s title, choose your desired demo and login to your Envato account to confirm your theme license. This whole process only take a few minutes and all you need to do is just click on the Next button.

While choosing the demo you want to install, you may want to choose Visual Composer Page builder to import demo:

After the installation is done, you can visit your site again and it will amaze you. The site will be completely different from your old design and similar to the demo site that you chose. Now you’re about 80% close to your Udemy clone process. Your website is now more similar to Udemy than ever.

In case it is hard to understand, we made a video tutorial where we described step-by-step of how to install the theme Eduma | Premium Education WordPress Theme (a.k.a the best LMS and Education WordPress theme) and set it up to make it look 95% like an Udemy Clone with all of its function. The great thing is this theme will be updated regularly to adapt with the upcoming changes and to be better.

4. How to create your first online course

Create an LMS Website with LearnPress Once theme installation is complete, we will go through basic course editing features. Since we installed LearnPress LMS (and the theme already included LearnPress LMS), we will go to the admin dashboard to start configuring your course site.

Taking a look at the LearnPress backend, you will see the following menus:

Each will be used to manage one specific part in your LMS. For example: you can manage all courses in the Courses menu. Each course consists of a number of Lessons and Quizzes and in each quiz, there are several Questions.

If you want to know who took which course, you can go to Orders. Statistics is the place to see some LearnPress stats. Add-ons is where you will install more features to LearnPress. In this case, because you bought our LearnPress premium theme, you wouldn’t have to worry about buying more premium add-ons. Just go there and you will be able to install and activate any premium feature of LearnPress. You can edit your LMS settings related to payment, pages, email, etc. in the settings menu.

4.1. Let’s try and create a course:

  • Go to Courses menu, click on Add new to add a new course.
  • You will see the course editor page with plenty of blank form fields to edit. This is where you will add your course title, course description and everything related to the course such as curriculum, course setting, course duration, course payment or even define terms for passing the course.

In the curriculum setting, you can just add the name of the lessons and then we will edit each lesson content and each lesson setting later. If you have prepared some lessons before, you can click on choose lesson to choose your prepared lesson.

When everything is done, choose a Category for the course, add some tags, a featured image and click on publish to publish the course.

If you want to link your course to your current course on Udemy or other Online teaching platforms, in the General settings tab, you can find the External link buy course. Just add the link of your external course there and the student will be redirected to your external course whenever they click on Enroll

4.2. Editing Lessons: Editing

  • Editing Lessons: After publishing courses, you have created all lessons. You can preview the course and edit each lesson while previewing it or in the course editor page, you will find an edit button for every lesson. Here you can add everything to your lesson in the lesson editor

.

  • Additionally, you can change the name of the lesson, change the content of the lesson to whatever you want, add images, texts, videos or even PowerPoint slides here. You can also add the lesson duration here and choose if it is a preview lesson or not. If you want the lesson to have a video format, find the Media box in the lesson setting and add an embed frame tag to your video.
  • Here is an example of a nicely configured video lesson:

4.3. Editing Quiz

Editing Quizzes are a little bit more complicated than Lessons because they contain questions. You can edit quiz the same way you edit lesson content, by editing when previewing quiz content or via the curriculum. In the quiz editor, you can add title and description of the quiz. If you want your students to learn something before taking the quiz, you can add them there.

Below the general settings, there are some advanced quizzing settings:

There’s the show/hide question. You can hide your question if you want. There’s also a Duration input for the quiz which limits the maximum amount of time your student can spend for the quiz. You can set to zero to disable it. Then you can specify the passing grade type of the quiz, by percentage or point or even disable it.

You can also give your students another chance by setting the re-take and you can also show the button “Check Answer” while the students are doing the quiz. You can also give hints to your questions.

4.4 Then we will start creating questions:

You can add each question, one by one. If you have created some questions before, you can click on Add Existing Question to import it to your quiz. There are several question types like Single Choice, Multiple Choice and True or False. You can add some more question types like Fill in the blank, etc. if you enable them in the Add-on tab.

For this question editor, you will only be able to add question content and the correct answer. However, if you want to edit the detail of each question like giving long description, adding hints and explanation, give a different score to each question, you can save the quiz and click on the edit button right next to each question.

Here is each question’s general setting section. If you want to give explanation and hints to your students, you can add here. Remember, Hint appears before they submit the answer and Explanation displays after they have submitted the question.

That’s almost all you need to know to create and configure your online course.

5. Installing other LMS features for an Udemy clone

Besides giving content to the course, there are several other things you may need to add you your LMS website. They are: payment setting, coupon, instructor, etc. Now we will go through some of them:

5.1 How to get all of your Premium LearnPress Add-on Bundle?

In the past, the LearnPress Add-on Bundle is quite heavy. Therefore, users have to download them separately and then upload and install them separately from the theme.

However, now the technology has changed. You don't have to download the LearnPress Premium Bundle separated from the theme anymore. It is automatically included in your theme package. Just update the theme to the latest version and it will be automatically installed to your site.

5.2 How to translate your WordPress theme to your language using Loco Translate Plugin

5.3 How to add instructors to your course - all about LearnPress instructors.

5.4 How to add membership/subscription plans to your online course site.

5.5 How to add and edit Certificate in your site

5.6 How to add coupon to your website

5.7 How to edit Mega menu

Final thoughts on creating Coursera, Udemy clone

I hope this article will give you a clue on what building an online course & Learning management system website and a Udemy clone website will be like. If you need any help, feel free to comment below and we will be happy to help.

Also, be creative, don’t follow the footsteps of others! Even though making a clone of a good business model can bring you benefits quick and easy, your product and your company should have some value and trademark of your own. LearnPress did an awesome job of giving you the tool to build an LMS and Education WordPress website. Education WP gave you the chance to build your website fast and easy, and unique. Now all you need to do is: build course content, curriculum, lessons, quizzes for your students and sell your courses.

If you are curious which of Education WP's demo looks similar to Udemy the most, check this screenshot:

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe title="LMS Website and LearnPress Introduction (Part 1)" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TKzfxKSJMjE?list=PLEMIeEcjPUVNlsPM_VSH6qs-nQW-fpMJ4" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

item.title: Many desktop publishing packages
item.dc:creator: viettrungle
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever read our LearnPress Documentation?

Normally, you’ll have a crazy time figuring out if a line of code you are working on is failing. You need to re-check the code, semicolons, and others. However, you cannot find any mistakes. And of course, you need to open technical documentation.

In addition, this technical documentation isn’t easy to read, especially if you’re a new coder. Each document is written by different people, so it’s hard to adjust to their writing style. Sometimes, there are jargons that newbies don’t know yet, and terms used in this language can be used a bit differently in another language. You even need to determine the differences in the details of each language, like which bracket is used.

Luckily, you never need to take care of all of the above things. You can easily understand our LearnPress documentation without touching a single line of code. It’s suitable for any level, even without coding skills.  Simply follow the steps, and surely you can install and set up the LearnPress #1 LMS WordPress Plugin quickly. There is a quick LearnPress Review: Features, Benefits, Pricing. So you can refer first.

Even if our documentation is simple, we still provide some tips to make sure anyone won’t miss anything we write. Let’s get started!

8 Tips to Reading LearnPress Documentation

Be patient - LearnPress Developer Documentation

Similarly to other learning processes, it takes time to read the documentation and understand its meaning. In particular, if you read LearnPress Developer Documentation - a document written to describe any aspect of how ThimPress developers need to interact with a given software library or service and start to feel overwhelmed or frustrated, you can stop, relax, and take a break. Just come back to read if you have a clear head with exciting feelings.

If the developer’s documentation isn’t suitable for you, the LearnPress admin guide, LearnPress instructor guide, LearnPress student guide, or LearnPress installation guide has been around long enough for you to refer to. If you have read it, you’ll know how easy it is to get started with your LMS system quickly.

Review terms - LearnPress Documentation

There are some terms you might see while reading LearnPress Documentation such as method, object, and instance. However, these terms can have different connotations apart from the coding world. So we highly recommend you review key terms regularly so you’ll not meet any problems when coming across themes in any documentation.

Develop a reference library – LearnPress Examples

Nowadays, online documentation is replacing traditional documentation like the printed book since people can get information quickly and easily using the internet. However, online sources sometimes are not really accurate. It can be from the speed of the produced process.

And printed books can become backward or outdated when technology is more and more developing. But printed books are reliable reference materials and no others can replace them. So you should read both documentation online and printed books to clarify all concepts.

To check our great reference library, you can refer to the LearnPress Examples guide which is written by our experts.

Use multiple sources

LearnPress Documentation uses multiple sources to make sure even newbies can understand our guide with ease. If you read other technical documentation, you might see some gaps that possible newbies don’t understand a key point. It’s common to mistake that we can not assure readers know what we know.

To solve this matter, newbies can read the same topics on multiple websites to fill in the lacking knowledge of the previous document you have read. In addition, when you read multiple sources, this way can help you explore the useful websites that are suitable for your need.

Read the overview

Read the overview of LearnPress WordPress Plugin Documentation is another important tip you need to take care of to get full information while using the plugin. So you can know clearly what’s going on without any problem.

Check the version

You should check version control and version numbers you are using before reading LearnPress Documentation since it will come with different guides. Also, you might check the version details and change notes to know exactly when and how issues with the code were addressed.

If you plan to understand the detail of the WordPress system, you should learn to read the code. It’s a good chance since reading documentation is not enough sometimes. Knowing code should help you understand what’s happening with a program quickly and easily. So you can inspect the source code, read & analyze the code and see what it is doing from the code examples instead of copying them. Testing, changing, breaking, and fixing the code back is possible.

Clean up the code

You always need to clean up the code and make it organized so everyone can read your code effectively and understand documentation effectively. You can start by arranging the brackets, for example. Good code on the front end can help you when necessary.

Lastly, LearnPress WordPress Plugin Documentation with developer guide gives you a clean code to impress new coders or easier for search engines to understand.

Final Thoughts

LearnPress Documentation is available for everyone. It’s easy to read and suitable for even with no coding skills users. However, it’s great if you are a coder so you can discover and know how the code is working. The best way to learn and read documentation is just to be patient and practice a lot.

Read More: Paid Memberships Pro: Membership Plugin for Learnpress
